--- title: "Take-Home Exercise 1" author: - name: Matthew Ho url: https://www.linkedin.com/in/matthewhoyiwen/ date: 01-19-2024 description: | Take-Home Exercise 1 categories: - Take-Home Exercise format: html: toc: true execute: eval: true echo: true warning: false --- ## 1.0 Overview ### 1.1 Objectives #### Exercise Requirements 1. Using appropriate function of sf and tidyverse, preparing the following geospatial data layer in sf tibble data.frames: - Grab taxi location points either by origins or destinations. - Road layer within Singapore excluding outer islands. - Singapore boundary layer excluding outer islands 2. Using the extracted data, derive traditional Kernel Density Estimation layers. 3. Using the extracted data, derive either Network Kernel Density Estimation (NKDE) or Temporal Network Kernel Density Estimation (TNKDE) Using appropriate tmap functions, display the kernel density layers on openstreetmap of Singapore. 4. Describe the spatial patterns revealed by the kernel density maps. ### 1.2 Approach This exercise seems quite straightforward, but I think that some genuinely useful information can be derived from this data. While removing the outer islands can be done fairly easily, I think that other small issues, like holes in the geometry will need to be fixed. NKDE may also require very long computation times for large areas, especially given the magnitude of the entire dataset. The GrabPosisi dataset's journey start and destination locations likely occur along smaller roads where people can walk. These small roads are likely near other small roads, which will greatly increase the number of affect lixels for every NKDE operation. Since these small roads will have the most interesting data, I will have to scale down my analysis to smaller locations determined by the simpler KDE analysis. ## 2.0 Setup ### 2.1 Dependencies Aside from the tools used in class, I also included some additional tools I found useful. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} pacman::p_load(tidyverse, sf, tmap, maptools, spatstat, spNetwork, tmap, classInt, viridis, smoothr, arrow, stringr, purrr) ``` ::: ### 2.2 Datasets #### Aspatial data Grab-Posisi Singapore dataset #### Geospatial data 1. Road data set from Geofabrik's OpenStreetMap. - Although the dataset includes all of Malaysia, Singapore, and Brunei, only Singapore's data will required. 2. Master Plan 2019 Subzone Boundary (No Sea) from Data.gov.sg. ## 3.0 Data Wrangling ### 3.1 Importing Data #### Reading the Grab-Posisi Parquet Files ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} grabp <- open_dataset("data/aspatial/GrabPosisi/") %>% as.data.frame() ``` ::: #### Opening the geospatial data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mpsz = st_read("data/geospatial/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Reading layer `URA_MP19_SUBZONE_NO_SEA_PL' from data source `/Users/matthewho/Work/Y3S2/IS415/Website/IS415/TakeHomeEx/TakeHomeEx1/data/geospatial/MasterPlan2019SubzoneBoundaryNoSeaKML.kml' using driver `KML' Simple feature collection with 332 features and 2 fields Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON Dimension: XY, XYZ Bounding box: xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775 z_range: zmin: 0 zmax: 0 Geodetic CRS: WGS 84 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mpsz$Description[1] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "
Attributes
SUBZONE_NO 12
SUBZONE_N DEPOT ROAD
SUBZONE_C BMSZ12
CA_IND N
PLN_AREA_N BUKIT MERAH
PLN_AREA_C BM
REGION_N CENTRAL REGION
REGION_C CR
INC_CRC C22DED671DE2A940
FMEL_UPD_D 20191223152313
" ``` ::: ::: https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/r-using-stringr-extract-information-from-html-tags-kml-melvin-kew/ ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mpsz <- mpsz %>% mutate(Match=str_match_all(Description,"(.*?)")) %>% mutate(Match=map(Match, ~ .[,2])) %>% mutate(Match=map(Match,setNames,c("SUBZONE_NO","SUBZONE_N","SUBZONE_C", "CA_IND", "PLN_AREA_N", "PLN_AREA_C", "REGION_N", "REGION_C", "INC_CRC", "FMEL_UPD_D"))) %>% unnest_wider(Match) %>% st_as_sf() ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} summary(mpsz) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Name Description geometry SUBZONE_NO Length:332 Length:332 MULTIPOLYGON : 11 Length:332 Class :character Class :character MULTIPOLYGON Z:321 Class :character Mode :character Mode :character epsg:4326 : 0 Mode :character +proj=long... : 0 SUBZONE_N SUBZONE_C CA_IND PLN_AREA_N Length:332 Length:332 Length:332 Length:332 Class :character Class :character Class :character Class :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character PLN_AREA_C REGION_N REGION_C INC_CRC Length:332 Length:332 Length:332 Length:332 Class :character Class :character Class :character Class :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character FMEL_UPD_D Length:332 Class :character Mode :character ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} mpsz <- mpsz %>% dplyr::select('Name', 'Description', 'geometry', 'SUBZONE_NO', 'SUBZONE_N', 'PLN_AREA_N', 'PLN_AREA_C', 'REGION_N', 'REGION_C') summary(mpsz) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Name Description geometry SUBZONE_NO Length:332 Length:332 MULTIPOLYGON : 11 Length:332 Class :character Class :character MULTIPOLYGON Z:321 Class :character Mode :character Mode :character epsg:4326 : 0 Mode :character +proj=long... : 0 SUBZONE_N PLN_AREA_N PLN_AREA_C REGION_N Length:332 Length:332 Length:332 Length:332 Class :character Class :character Class :character Class :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character Mode :character REGION_C Length:332 Class :character Mode :character ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} osm = st_read("data/geospatial/osm.shp.zip", layer="gis_osm_roads_free_1") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Reading layer `gis_osm_roads_free_1' from data source `/Users/matthewho/Work/Y3S2/IS415/Website/IS415/TakeHomeEx/TakeHomeEx1/data/geospatial/osm.shp.zip' using driver `ESRI Shapefile' Simple feature collection with 1763129 features and 10 fields Geometry type: LINESTRING Dimension: XY Bounding box: xmin: 99.66041 ymin: 0.8021131 xmax: 119.2601 ymax: 7.514393 Geodetic CRS: WGS 84 ``` ::: ::: ### 3.2 Basic preprocessing ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} head(grabp) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 × 9 trj_id driving_mode osname pingtimestamp rawlat rawlng speed bearing accuracy 1 70014 car android 1554943236 1.34 104. 18.9 248 3.9 2 73573 car android 1555582623 1.32 104. 17.7 44 4 3 75567 car android 1555141026 1.33 104. 14.0 34 3.9 4 1410 car android 1555731693 1.26 104. 13.0 181 4 5 4354 car android 1555584497 1.28 104. 14.8 93 3.9 6 32630 car android 1555395258 1.30 104. 23.2 73 3.9 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} grabp$pingtimestamp <- as_datetime(grabp$pingtimestamp) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} origin_df <- grabp %>% group_by(trj_id) %>% arrange(pingtimestamp) %>% filter(row_number()==1) %>% mutate(weekday = wday(pingtimestamp, label=TRUE, abbr=TRUE), start_hr = factor(hour(pingtimestamp)), day = factor(mday(pingtimestamp))) %>% st_as_sf(coords = c("rawlng", "rawlat"), crs = 4326) %>% st_transform(crs = 3414) destination_df <- grabp %>% group_by(trj_id) %>% arrange(desc(pingtimestamp)) %>% filter(row_number()==1) %>% mutate(weekday = wday(pingtimestamp, label=TRUE, abbr=TRUE), end_hr = factor(hour(pingtimestamp)), day = factor(mday(pingtimestamp))) %>% st_as_sf(coords = c("rawlng", "rawlat"), crs = 4326) %>% st_transform(crs = 3414) head(origin_df) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Simple feature collection with 6 features and 10 fields Geometry type: POINT Dimension: XY Bounding box: xmin: 17201.85 ymin: 29236.55 xmax: 31518.05 ymax: 47967.97 Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM # A tibble: 6 × 11 # Groups: trj_id [6] trj_id driving_mode osname pingtimestamp speed bearing accuracy weekday 1 70895 car andro… 2019-04-08 00:09:26 9.95 111 4 Mon 2 21926 car andro… 2019-04-08 00:09:48 11.0 75 4 Mon 3 47498 car ios 2019-04-08 00:09:50 18.6 307 8 Mon 4 18103 car andro… 2019-04-08 00:09:55 0.404 159 3 Mon 5 41322 car andro… 2019-04-08 00:09:57 17.9 232 3.9 Mon 6 64813 car ios 2019-04-08 00:10:03 17.1 106 10 Mon # ℹ 3 more variables: start_hr , day , geometry ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} head(destination_df) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Simple feature collection with 6 features and 10 fields Geometry type: POINT Dimension: XY Bounding box: xmin: 14101.2 ymin: 33097.49 xmax: 44192.98 ymax: 46866.96 Projected CRS: SVY21 / Singapore TM # A tibble: 6 × 11 # Groups: trj_id [6] trj_id driving_mode osname pingtimestamp speed bearing accuracy weekday 1 81574 car ios 2019-04-21 23:56:49 15.3 103 8 Sun 2 54687 car android 2019-04-21 23:56:46 8.15 299 4.55 Sun 3 17190 car android 2019-04-21 23:56:36 12.4 202 4 Sun 4 13793 car android 2019-04-21 23:56:30 6.47 170 3.9 Sun 5 39014 car ios 2019-04-21 23:56:27 3.59 169 4 Sun 6 41170 car ios 2019-04-21 23:56:13 13.1 71 5 Sun # ℹ 3 more variables: end_hr , day , geometry ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} origin_df <- origin_df %>% dplyr::select('trj_id', 'pingtimestamp', 'geometry', 'weekday', 'start_hr', 'day', 'geometry') destination_df <- destination_df %>% dplyr::select('trj_id', 'pingtimestamp', 'geometry', 'weekday', 'end_hr', 'day', 'geometry') ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} write_rds(origin_df, "data/rds/origin.rds") write_rds(destination_df, "data/rds/destination.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} destination_df <- read_rds("data/rds/destination.rds") origin_df <- read_rds("data/rds/origin.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} head(osm) ``` ::: {.cell-output mapping."], AREA["Singapore - onshore and offshore."], BBOX[1.13,103.59,1.47,104.07]], ID["EPSG",3414]] ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} st_crs(osm) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Coordinate .cell-code} osm <- osm %>% dplyr::select('osm_id', 'fclass') ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(st_geometry(mpsz)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: #### Outer Island: An island in Singapore inaccessible by road Therefore, Coney Island, Jurong Island and Sentosa are not outer islands. Pulau Ubin and Pulau Tekong are examples of outer islands. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} merged_sg <- st_union(mpsz) %>% st_cast("POLYGON") merged_sg <- merged_sg[c(10)] merged_sg <- fill_holes(merged_sg, units::set_units(1, "km^2")) merged_sg <- st_as_sf(merged_sg) par(1,2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] NULL [[2]] NULL ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} plot(st_geometry(mpsz)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} plot(st_geometry(merged_sg)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-2.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} write_rds(merged_sg, "data/rds/merged_sg.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} merged_sg <- read_rds("data/rds/merged_sg.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} merged_st <- as_Spatial(merged_sg) merged_sg_sp <- as(merged_st, "SpatialPolygons") merged_sg_owin <- as(merged_sg_sp, "owin") write_rds(merged_sg_owin, "data/rds/merged_sg_owin.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # merged_sg_owin <- read_rds("data/rds/merged_sg_owin.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} osm_sg <- st_intersection(osm, merged_sg) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} osm_sg <- st_cast(st_cast(osm_sg, "MULTILINESTRING"),"LINESTRING") summary(osm_sg) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` osm_id fclass geometry Length:157836 Length:157836 LINESTRING :157836 Class :character Class :character epsg:3414 : 0 Mode :character Mode :character +proj=tmer...: 0 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} write_rds(osm_sg, "data/rds/osm_sg.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} osm_sg <- read_rds("data/rds/osm_sg.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(osm_sg) ``` ::: origin_sp <- as(origin, "SpatialPoints") destination_sp <- as(destination, "SpatialPoints") origin_ppp <- as(origin_sp, "ppp") destination_ppp <- as(destination_sp, "ppp") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} origin_ppp <- origin_ppp[merged_sg_owin] destination_ppp <- destination_ppp[merged_sg_owin] ``` ::: ### 3.4 Simple Visualisations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} plot(origin_ppp) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-34-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} plot(destination_ppp) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-34-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} any(duplicated(origin_ppp)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] FALSE ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} any(duplicated(destination_ppp)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] FALSE ``` ::: ::: #### 4.0 KDE ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sapply(origin_ppp, class) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` window n x y markformat "owin" "integer" "numeric" "numeric" "character" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} sapply(origin_ppp, typeof) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` window n x y markformat "list" "integer" "double" "double" "character" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} class(origin_ppp) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "ppp" ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} origin_ppp$x <- as.numeric(origin_ppp$x) summary(origin_ppp) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Planar point pattern: 28000 points Average intensity 3.995238e-05 points per square unit Coordinates are given to 3 decimal places i.e. rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.001 units Window: polygonal boundary single connected closed polygon with 15268 vertices enclosing rectangle: [2667.54, 51404.13] x [21448.48, 50256.33] units (48740 x 28810 units) Window area = 700834000 square units Fraction of frame area: 0.499 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} par(1,2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [[1]] NULL [[2]] NULL ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} origin.bw <- density(origin_ppp, sigma=bw.diggle, edge=TRUE, kernel="quartic") plot(origin.bw) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-38-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} origin_ppp.km <- rescale(origin_ppp, 1000, "km") origin.bw <- density(origin_ppp.km, sigma=bw.diggle, edge=TRUE, kernel="quartic") plot(origin.bw) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-38-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-42-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} osm_changi_i <- st_intersection(osm_sg, mpsz_changi) osm_changi_idxs <- as.numeric(osm_changi_i$osm_id) osm_changi<- osm_sg[osm_sg$osm_id %in% osm_changi_idxs, ] plot(osm_changi) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-43-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} destination_df.changi = st_intersection(destination_df, mpsz_changi) plot(destination_df.changi) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](THE1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-44-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lixels <- lixelize_lines(osm_changi, 200, mindist = 100) samples <- lines_center(lixels) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} densities <- nkde(osm_changi, events=destination_df.changi, w=rep(1, nrow(destination_df.changi)), samples=samples, kernel_name="quartic", bw=500, div="bw", method="simple", digits=1, tol=1, grid_shape=c(1,1), max_depth = 8, agg=5, sparse=TRUE, verbose = FALSE) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} samples$density <- densities lixels$density <- densities ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} samples$density <- samples$density*1000 lixels$density <- lixels$density*1000 ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # write_rds(samples, "data/rds/samples.rds") # write_rds(lixels, "data/rds/lixels.rds") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tm_shape(lixels) + tm_lines(col="density") ``` ::: {.cell-output-display}
